TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed BindingStatus extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the status of a binding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage You do not typically use this enumeration in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus Active = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The binding has been successfully activated. This means that the binding has been attached to its binding target (target) property and has located the binding source (source), resolved the and/or , and begun transferring values.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus AsyncRequestPending = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The binding is waiting for an asynchronous operation to complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus Detached = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The binding has been detached from its target property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus Inactive = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The binding has not been activated.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus PathError = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The binding was unable to resolve the source path.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus Unattached = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The binding has not yet been attached to its target property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus UpdateSourceError = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The binding was unable to send the value to the source property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Data.BindingStatus UpdateTargetError = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The binding could not successfully return a source value to update the target value. For more information, see the remarks on <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingBase.FallbackValue%2A>.
